etymologies: early 19th century (in an earlier sense). From ancient Greek πλήρωσις filling up, filling, becoming full, repletion from πληροῦν to fill + -σις

definitions: Originally . The action or process of being made full or complete, fulfilment.

notes.text: In later use especially in the context of categorizing rites and rituals, in opposition to kenosis ‘emptying’.
